page.title: 04KETTLEWELL, THE CHURCH
page.content: The church is called St. Mary's, first mentioned in the Domesday survey of the manor. A Norman church stood near the village's old King's Head Inn, but that was destroyed in the eighteenth century by fire or flash flood. A Norman or Saxon font remains. The tower is of ancient but unknown date. The first named priest was Radulphus, appointed by the Abbot of Coverham. A list of rectors and vicars hangs in the Church, and a framed document concerning tithes. The Bishop of Bradford is a patron. This year a new hand-carved oak altar has been dedicated, and a special three-day flower festival and other events have marked the re-opening 100 years ago of the rebuilt nave and chancel. The vicar is also vicar of Arncliffe with charge of Hubberholme and Conistone.
